1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Elihu, the name of one of Job's friends, and of three Israelites

2.brief: properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to be familiar with; by implication, to minister to, be serviceable to, be customary

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
properly, to ascend; figuratively, to be valuable (objectively; useful, subjectively; benefited)
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender

4.brief: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

5.brief: to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to spy out, i.e. (generally) survey, (for evil) lurk for, (for good) care for
a powder (as beaten small); by analogy, a thin vapor; by extension, the firmament
to soar, i.e. be lofty; figuratively, to be haughty
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

6.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
properly, to cast together , i.e. increase, especially in number; to multiply by the myriad

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

7.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to be (causatively, make) right (in a moral or forensic sense)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
desire (and so probably in Proverbs 31:4); hence (by way of alternative) or, also if

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to take (in the widest variety of applications)

8.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)

9.brief: used in plural masculine as abstractly, tyranny
to shriek (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to announce or convene publicly
properly, to be free; but used only causatively and reflexively, to halloo (for help, i.e. freedom from some trouble)
the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)

10.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a song to be accompanied with instrumental music
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity

11.brief: hence, to learn (and causatively to teach)
properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a bird (as covered with feathers, or rather as covering with wings), often collectively
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to be wise (in mind, word or act)

12.brief: there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
to shriek; (by implication) to proclaim (an assembly)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

13.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to spy out, i.e. (generally) survey, (for evil) lurk for, (for good) care for

14.brief: meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to spy out, i.e. (generally) survey, (for evil) lurk for, (for good) care for
judgement (the suit, justice, sentence or tribunal); by implication also strife
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert

15.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
stupidity (as a result of grossness or of degeneracy)
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)

16.brief: Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience
emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb
to rend, i.e. open (especially the mouth)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
properly, to plait together, i.e. (figuratively) to augment (especially in number or quantity, to accumulate)
